name: James P. Womack
background: James P. Womack is a leading expert in lean production and management. He was the research director of MIT's International Motor Vehicle Program (IMVP) and founder/chairman of the Lean Enterprise Institute. Womack popularized 'lean production' through his seminal work 'The Machine That Changed the World' (1990), based on comparative studies of automotive industries. He holds degrees from University of Chicago, Harvard, and MIT. Key books: 'Lean Thinking' (1996), 'Lean Solutions' (2005). Co-founded Lean Global Network.
